alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 8:11PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Natrona. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Bates Creek is included in this Flood Advisory. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 809 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Radar estimated rainfall between 0.75 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bates Hole. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
